title: Docker Cheatsheet
description: Quick reference for Docker commands. Never forget how to use Git again!

commands.name: docker run
commands.description: Run a command in a new container
commands.example:
docker run nginx
docker run -d -p 8080:80 nginx
docker run -it ubuntu bash

commands.name: docker ps
commands.example:
docker ps
docker ps -a
docker ps -l

commands.name: docker stop
commands.description: Stop one or more running containers
commands.example:
docker stop container_name
docker stop container_id

commands.name: docker start
commands.description: Start one or more stopped containers
commands.example:
docker start container_name
docker start container_id

commands.name: docker rm
commands.example:
docker rm container_name
docker rm -f container_name

commands.name: docker exec
commands.description: Run a command in a running container
commands.example:
docker exec -it container_name bash
docker exec container_name ls /app

commands.name: docker logs
commands.description: Fetch the logs of a container
commands.example:
docker logs container_name
docker logs -f container_name
docker logs --tail 50 container_name

commands.name: docker build
commands.description: Build an image from a Dockerfile
commands.example:
docker build .
docker build -t myapp .
docker build -f Dockerfile.prod .

commands.name: docker pull
commands.description: Pull an image or a repository from a registry
commands.example:
docker pull nginx
docker pull nginx:alpine

commands.name: docker push
commands.description: Push an image or a repository to a registry

commands.name: docker rmi
commands.example:
docker rmi image_name
docker rmi -f image_name

commands.name: docker network create
commands.example:
docker network create mynetwork
docker network create --driver bridge mynetwork

commands.name: docker network inspect
commands.description: Display detailed information on one or more networks

commands.name: docker volume inspect
commands.description: Display detailed information on one or more volumes

templates.name: Web App Template
templates.description: Docker Compose template for web applications
templates.content:
# docker-compose.yml for web app
version: '3.8'
services:
  web:
    build: .
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    volumes:
      - .:/app
      - /app/node_modules
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=development
    depends_on:
      - db
  db:
    image: postgres:13
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: user
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: password
      POSTGRES_DB: myapp
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    ports:
      - "5432:5432"
volumes:
  postgres_data:

templates.name: LAMP Stack Template
templates.description: Docker Compose template for LAMP stack
templates.content:
# docker-compose.yml for LAMP stack
version: '3.8'
services:
  web:
    image: nginx:alpine
    ports:
      - "8000:80"
    volumes:
      - ./src:/var/www/html
      - ./nginx.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf
    depends_on:
      - php
  php:
    image: php:8.1-fpm-alpine
    volumes:
      - ./src:/var/www/html
  db:
    image: mysql:8.0
    environment:
      MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: rootpassword
      MYSQL_DATABASE: myapp
      MYSQL_USER: user
      MYSQL_PASSWORD: password
    volumes:
      - mysql_data:/var/lib/mysql
    ports:
      - "3306:3306"
volumes:
  mysql_data:

templates.name: Docker Compose Commands
templates.content:
# Common Docker Compose commands
docker-compose up
docker-compose up -d
docker-compose down
docker-compose logs
docker-compose ps
docker-compose build
docker-compose exec service_name command

templates.name: Next.js Dockerfile
templates.content:
# Dockerfile for Next.js app
FROM node:18-alpine AS deps
RUN apk add --no-cache libc6-compat
WORKDIR /app
COPY package.json yarn.lock* package-lock.json* pnpm-lock.yaml* ./
RUN \
  if [ -f yarn.lock ]; then yarn --frozen-lockfile; \
  elif [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; \
  elif [ -f pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then yarn global add pnpm && pnpm i --frozen-lockfile; \
  else echo "Lockfile not found." && exit 1; \
  fi

FROM node:18-alpine AS builder
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=deps /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY . .
RUN npm run build

FROM node:18-alpine AS runner
WORKDIR /app
ENV NODE_ENV production
RUN addgroup --system --gid 1001 nodejs
RUN adduser --system --uid 1001 nextjs
COPY --from=builder /app/public ./public
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/standalone ./
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/static ./.next/static
USER nextjs
EXPOSE 3000
ENV PORT 3000
CMD ["node", "server.js"]

templates.name: React Dockerfile
templates.content:
# Dockerfile for React app
FROM node:18 AS dependencies
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci

FROM node:18 AS build
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=dependencies /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY . .
RUN npm run build

FROM nginx:alpine
COPY --from=build /app/build /usr/share/nginx/html
EXPOSE 80
CMD ["nginx", "-g", "daemon off;"]

templates.name: Vue.js Dockerfile
templates.content:
# Dockerfile for Vue.js app
FROM node:18 AS build-stage
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm ci
COPY . .
RUN npm run build

FROM nginx:alpine AS production-stage
COPY --from=build-stage /app/dist /usr/share/nginx/html
EXPOSE 80
CMD ["nginx", "-g", "daemon off;"]

templates.name: Python Dockerfile
templates.content:
# Dockerfile for Python app
FROM python:3.9-slim
WORKDIR /app
COPY requirements.txt .
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir -r requirements.txt
COPY . .
EXPOSE 5000
CMD ["python", "app.py"]

templates.name: Java Dockerfile
templates.content:
# Dockerfile for Java app
FROM openjdk:11-jre-slim
WORKDIR /app
COPY . .
RUN ./mvnw clean package
EXPOSE 8080
CMD ["java", "-jar", "target/app.jar"]
